comments.raw_text: Many issues I investigate on twitter are crashes in font handling. There's really no way for us to track these down without the actual list of installed fonts. I think crash reporter should send a list of installed fonts so we can correlate against crash signatures. I don't *think* this will be too personally identifiable but I guess for certain users who download a lot of custom fonts it fingerprints them.
comments.creator: christian@legnitto.com

comments.raw_text: The font list is a lot of bits of uniqueness, according to the EFF studies: I worry about this. Perhaps we could make a tool to just grab the list of fonts (or add them to about:support) from the users who appear to be having issues, as well as make sure we're fuzzing fonts?

comments.raw_text: I don't think sending the entire font list is such a great idea, it would be more interesting to know the actual font associated with a crash.  Something like if the browser crashed in text code recently, flag the current font in such a way that crash reporter can dig out that info when a crash in text code occurs.  I know Jeff has done similar things for hard to reproduce bugs in cairo so he probably understands the bits and pieces for preserving data for the crash reporter.
